etymology.description: Depicts a monkey with its long tail, which has also been associated with paired working in the fields
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicted a monkey, highlighting its connection in meaning to lively or disciplined motion, similar to agricultural activities.

examples.chinese: 两人禺于农田(兩人禺於農田)。
examples.english: Two people work in pairs in the fields.

examples.chinese: 邻居们共赴农忙季(鄰居們共赴農忙季)，齐心禺于良田(齊心禺於良田)。
examples.pinyin: Lín jū men gòng fù nóngmáng jì, qí xīn yú liáng tián.
examples.english: The neighbors rush to the busy farming season, and work in pairs in the fertile fields.

examples.chinese: 青年在乡间禺作(青年在鄉間禺作)，传承古法耕作(傳承古法耕作)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngnián zài xiāngjiān yú zuò, chuánchéng gǔ fǎ gēngzuò.
examples.english: The young people work in pairs in the countryside, inheriting the ancient farming methods.
